results.title: Interview
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Union Communication”
A factory worker complains to his union delegate when he is required to work overtime at short notice. The film pinpoints the need for the delegate to calm down the union member and sort out the facts before he can discuss the incident with management.

results.title: Interstellar
results.creator_credit: Legendary Entertainment, Syncopy, Lynda Obst Productions, Mary Zophres, Nathan Crowley, Christopher Nolan, Jonathan Nolan, Emma Thomas, Lynda Obst, Joe DeWalt Brown, Joseph A. Zaki and Will Lucas
results.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2014
results.brief_description: Interstellar chronicles the adventures of a group of explorers who make use of a newly discovered wormhole to surpass the limitations on human space travel and conquer the vast distances involved in an interstellar voyage.

constellations_other.name: There is no Planet B
constellations_other.description: While the climate emergency is very real, inspiring thousands and thousands of students to strike, documentaries, animated movies and dystopian genre films have warned about a world ravaged by global warming.

results.title: Intersection collision
results.creator_credit: Amir M Karimi and University of California, Los Angeles. Media Center
results.brief_description: Provides information on intersection collision and on safety devices, and procedures that can reduce injuries. Discusses factors associated with door latch failure and motorist ejection, demonstrates the protection provided to motorists by the combined shoulder strap and lap belt, presents preliminary findings on tempered glass breakage, and illustrates car collision deformation and skid patterns.

results.title: Interscan MLS
results.brief_description: In the quest for an international standard Microwave Landing System for aircraft, Australia has developmed Interscan. The CSIRO Division of Radio Physics undertook this development using their knowledge and technology acquired by their pioneering research into radio astronomy. Filmed at Tullamarine Airport, Melbourne.

results.title: Interruptions
results.creator_credit: Thomas MacNeil, William Hoke, Pacific Northwest Bell Telephone Company and Hoke Productions
results.brief_description: This film shows how seven individuals have accepted their disabilities and learned to transcend their limitations. It also shows how employers have dispensed of common prejudices and have employed handicapped individuals, and have found them to be effective workers.

results.title: Interrogation of enemy airmen
results.creator_credit: United States. Army Air Forces. First Motion Picture Unit
results.brief_description: An instructional film demonstrating the techniques available to army personnel involved in the interrogation of prisoners of war. Using classroom techniques and role playing scenarios, good and bad methods are demonstrated. Highlights the importance of examining a prisoner’s belongings to establish a personal profile before interrogation commences; shows how to use subordination techniques with captured officers to establish power and control; illustrates methods that may psychologically manipulate a prisoner to devulge intelligence information; shows how to identify the rank of a prisoner. Interrogation segments are in German, Italian and Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: Interrogation and counsel
results.brief_description: This film raises for discussion some alternative police interrogation procedures and the rights of the accused to notification of their rights and, if necessary, to effective legal representation. The Fifth and Sixth Amendments to the American Bill of Rights are presented and related to two simulated cases.

results.title: Interrogation = Przesluchanie [NTSC] (D)
results.creator_credit: Ryszard Bugajski, Tadeusz Drewno and Film Polski
results.brief_description: This powerful Polish drama about the methodical, psychological brutalization of a woman prisoner in totalitarian 1950s Warsaw was originally banned on its release in 1982 by the Polish government (then under martial law) who declared it to be inflammatory and dangerous. Director Ryszard Bugajski escaped to Canada with a smuggled copy of the film enabling him to show it at various film festivals until 1990 when the Cannes Film Festival awarded its Best Actress Award to Krystyna Janda for her riveting performance in the leading role of Tonia Dziwisz. Tonia is married, a cabaret singer out to enjoy life, rather naive and A-political. After a drunken one night stand with a military officer Tonia awakens the morning after to find herself in a prison cell with several other women prisoners, and with no knowledge as to how and why she is there. The story takes a chilling turn and we are witness to some of the most horrifying abuse and torture, relentless in its intensity and disturbing in its graphically realistic images. The vicious interrogations which Tonia is continually subjected to only increase her inner strength to survive, to maintain her dignity and her sanity and to never give up. As harrowing and confronting as it may be, this film is compulsory viewing, brilliant in its directing and its cast with Janusz Gajos and Adam Ferency in the roles of the interrogators - Gajos as the meticulous but sadistically cruel Citizen Major and Ferency as the second but more sympathetic interrogator, Morawsky. “Interrogation” will stay with you long after you have seen it. Cast also includes Agnieszke Holland and Anna Romantowska. WARNING: CONTAINS MANY DISTURBING IMAGES, VIOLENCE AND NUDITY.

results.title: Interregnum
results.creator_credit: Edward King, V.R. Sarma, George Movshon and United Nations Television
results.brief_description: Documents a particular example of United Nations co-operation during the takeover of West New Guinea (Irian Jaya) from the Dutch by the Indonesians. For a period of seven months, the United Nations Organization took over the responsibility for the running of the government of the country. This period marked an important development in the history of United Nations work towards international peace and understanding. Presented by Alistair Cooke.

results.title: Interpreting scientific data
results.creator_credit: Ken J. Widdowson and Educational Media Australia
results.brief_description: Presents a case study of a citrus orchard to allow students to interpret the results of an experiment based on scientific data supplied by a trained horticulturalist. Portrays science as a continuing process of inquiry.
